description:
Upon entering university, Hinako moves to a coastal town. She loves surfing, and when she's on the waves she's fearless, but still feels uncertain about her future. When a fire wreaks havoc in the town, Hinako encounters young firefighter Minato. As they surf and spend more time together, Hinako feels drawn to someone like Minato who devotes himself to helping other people. Hinako also holds a special place in Minato's heart.

(Source: Toho)
hashtag: #きみと波にのれたら #きみ波
synonyms: El amor está en el agua

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.description: Centers around surfing as a sport.

tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Firefighters
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of rescuers specialised in firefighting.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaakiyuasa)

An acclaimed anime director known for his wild, freeform style. 

After graduating from the Kyushu Sangyo University's Faculty of Arts in 1987 he joined studio [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/Ajiado), initially as in-betweener but rapidly moving to key animation. 

In the first part of his career Yuasa established himself as an idiosyncratic creator while working on several child friendly anime, such as [Chibi Maruko-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/951/Chibi-Marukochan/) and [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2677/Doraemon-Nobitas-Animal-Planet/), but especially on [Crayon Shin-chan](https://anilist.co/anime/966/Shin-Chan/), a project he was involved with for most of the '90s. 

One of his breakthrough roles in this period was his participation on the second part of [The Hakkenden](https://anilist.co/anime/12715/The-Hakkenden-Legend-of-the-Dog-Warriors-Part-2/), working as animation director under [Shinya Oohira](https://anilist.co/staff/103893/Shinya-Oohira)'s direction. This OVA was an important outing of the '90s, uniting many veteran artists and talented newcomers. 

He debuted as director on [Mind Game](https://anilist.co/anime/875/Mind-Game/), an abstract piece combining animation and live-action footage, winning the 2004 Japan Media Arts Festival (overcoming even Hayao Miyazaki's [Howl's Moving Castle](https://anilist.co/anime/431/Howls-Moving-Castle/)), and earning [Yoshiyuki Tomino](https://anilist.co/staff/97337/Yoshiyuki-Tomino)'s praise, who acted as the chief judge. After Mind Game Yuasa spent several years at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) working on various projects. In 2013, he founded [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/Science-SARU) alongside his close affiliate [Eun-Yeong Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/EunYeong-Choi).

On March 25, 2020 it was announced Yuasa stepped down as the CEO of Science SARU. He would work there as director until the completion of his latest Movie, [Inu-Oh](https://anilist.co/anime/109928/InuOh/), and would later cease any affiliation with the studio.

On February 17, 2025 it was announced that Yuasa would launch of his own animation studio, ame pippin. Their debut project would be the film [Daisy's Life](https://anilist.co/anime/190574/Hinagiku-no-Jinsei/).

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://eriklidbom.com/) | [Profile (Soundgraphics)](https://soundgraphics.net/creators/erik-lidbom)__

__Erik Lidbom__, alternatively known by birth name Erik Gustav Lidbom, is a Swedish vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger known for his involvement in J-POP and K-POP.

__[Profile (Rhythm Zone)](https://www.rhythmzone.net/wadamasaya/index.html)__

__Masaya Wada__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger affiliated with the record label Rhythm Zone.
__Takuya Haruda__, alternatively known by stage name FAST LANE, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger.

Rina Kawaei is a Japanese actress and former member of idol group AKB48 (2010-2015).

node.description:
__[Website](https://m.tribe-m.jp/artist/index/37) | [Profile (LDH)](https://www.generations-ldh.com/about.html) | [Website (Fan Club)](https://exfamily.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/generationsfext) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/generations_official/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GENERATIONS.official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@generations_official_)__

__Formed:__ 2012
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock, Pop (Dance-pop), R&B

__Introduction:__
GENERATIONS from EXILE TRIBE, alternatively known as Generations, is a Japanese seven-member boy band born from the dance-pop mega group EXILE TRIBE. Fusing together a uniquely Japanese personality with, international attitude, World-Class dance talent, nimble but soaring vocals, and cutting edge grandiose live performances, GENERATIONS has become known to fans around the world as the next stage of Japanese and Western Pop. The group is currently under record labels LDH and Rhythm Zone, while affiliated and managed by entertainment agency LDH. 

__Members:__
\- Alan Shirahama (白濱亜嵐, しらはま あらん) – leader, performer
\- [Ryouta Katayose](https://anilist.co/staff/157187/Ryouta-Katayose) (片寄涼太, かたよせ りょうた) – vocalist
\- Ryuuto Kazuhara (数原龍友, かずはら りゅうと) – vocalist
\- Hayato Komori (小森隼, こもり はやと) – performer
\- Reo Sano (佐野玲於, さの れお) – performer
\- Mandy Sekiguchi (関口メンディー, せきぐち メンディー) – performer
\- Yuuka Nakatsuka (中務裕太, なかつか ゆうた) – performer

__Affiliations:__
\- [Exile](https://anilist.co/staff/105528/Exile)
\- Exile Tribe
\- Jr.Exile

[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6RexcbImnLm1O83WNPzZV2) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/ryota-katayose/957661806) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/ryota_katayose__official) | [Weibo](http://weibo.com/ryotakatayoseoffical)

Ryota Katayose is a singer, performer, actor and model. He belongs to the J-pop group GENERATIONS from EXILE TRIBE under the talent agency LDH JAPAN.

Having music teachers as both his grandfather and father, he grew up playing the piano. He performed mostly as an accompanist at choir contests, and didn't have any thought of becoming an entertainer. But after being fascinated by the performance of the well-known J-pop group EXILE in a live concert that his mother invited him to, he considered the idea for the first time. Spurred on by his penchant for singing and compliments for it at karaoke, he decided to go for it in high school. His budding dream of becoming an artist grew slowly as he was further inspired by the passionate fellow auditionees, and the words of EXILE's vocalist ATSUSHI to him. So despite not being selected after reaching the final of a major vocal audition, he seriously began taking lessons with scholarship at EXPG — a school of performing arts from LDH. A year later he became a candidate member of the group GENERATIONS, and another year later, in 2012, he made his debut with the group as an official member.

Besides his position as mainly a vocalist and also a performer (dancer), he wrote lyrics for his group a few times as well. Additionally, he's quite active as a model and actor. The protagonist's role in the live-action adaptation of the manga "Ani ni Aisaresugite Komattemasu" earned him a breakthrough in his career. Since then, he has acted in several J-dramas and movies, including "Gozen 0-ji, Kiss Shi ni Kite yo" — a live-action adaptation of another manga. In 2019, he did his debut voice acting for the protagonist Minato Hinageshi from the anime movie "Kimi to, Nami ni Noretara." He also sang the movie's theme song Brand New Story as one of the vocalists of GENERATIONS. As of September 2021, he has released two solo singles as a part of shows he starred in.

Ryota is the first Japanese male celebrity to be selected by Variety as one of the most promising stars of Asia's next generation, winning one of the "8 Asian Stars: Up Next" awards at Macao's 4th International Film Festival & Awards. He also attained the Popular Artist Award at WEIBO Account Festival in Japan 2018, which became a testament of his vast popularity in China alongside his homeland.
__Takuya Haruda__, alternatively known by stage name FAST LANE, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger.
Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
